comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This woman is Pamela Bromley-Smith who became Valentin Zeglovsky's wife in 1949. Here is a page 1 story from The Mail of Saturday 22 November, 1947 which displays a photograph of Pamela Bromley-Smith for comparison with this one: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article55894727 The Dupain photograph is stunning.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] Nice ID Bob! The digitised newspapers are proving a wonderful resource, aren't they?
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/] You may want to correct the license settings for this photograph - you have it set to "No known copyright restrictions [?]" but mention in the description "Copyright: Max Dupain, with permission of Jill White".

comment._content: wow This is great !!

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: Thanks Bob, we've investigated Pamela Bromley-Smith and aren't convinced. This woman is probably a ballet dancer as her ballet poses in other photographs with Zeglovsky look professional. The courtesy note to Jill White is a courtesy. The photograph was taken before 31 December 1954 and is therefore out of copyright in Australia.
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw]  I've had the opportunity to correspond with Mr. Leo Zeglovskis. 

He tells me that this is a photograph of his mother, Pamela Bromley-Smith.

comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: If this is Pamela Bromley-Smith, wife of ballet dancer and teacher Valentin Zeglovsky, she was Miss New South Wales 1947, and performed as an actor for Doris Fitton's Independent Theatre company in the 1950's
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection
